name: Jumping Ginger Smoothie
description: An amazing smoothie to perk up your morning in place of coffee. Particularly good for a little 'morning after' help. Best with a high-power blender/juicer. I'm a foodie, but not a health-foodie. First and foremost, this thing is crazy delicious. It also happens to be a good way to get more fresh veggies into your day. Bonus!
recipeIngredient: 1 leaf kale leaf, or more to taste
1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Blend water, avocado, parsley, apple, carrot, lemon, kale, ginger, ice cubes, and flax seeds in a blender on high until smooth, 10 to 15 seconds.

review.reviewBody: As long as I'm making healthy smoothies I leave the peel on the apple and don't bother to core it. I didn't peel the carrot either! This was easy to make! The citrus really wakes up the taste buds! Great breakfast!

This is delicious! The only change I made was using spinach instead of kale. Yum! Apple-wise since it didn't say what type to use I used a Braeburn my favorite. The apple and lemon flavors are most prominent accompanied by the subtle creamy undertones of the avocado. Consistency-wise this smoothie is slightly thicker than thin. If you like thicker smoothies add the optional ice. I did not and it is going down smooth. Makes about 4.5 cups of smoothie.

I like lemon but this was way too lemony for me. Next time I would put just the juice of 1/2 a lemon. Also would add more ice and/or make sure the water (I use filtered) was ice cold. Other than that great smoothie with a lot of nutrients.

This was actually a really good tasting drink! I'm not sure what it was about it but it also had my dog following me around the house crying to have some haha! Perhaps it was the ginger root I had never used it prior to making this!

Really liked this smoothie! My blender is not high-power or a juicer but it is nicer than your average 20 blender and this blended very smooth for me without having to pre-blend or prepare the ingredients beforehand. The taste was just right for me and I didn't add any sugar or honey but I know some people prefer a sweeter smoothie. All in all pretty fantastic and healthy to boot!
I really love this! I added a little cilantro and used 3 kale leaves instead of one did not add ice or flaxseed. Delicious and a keeper for my kitchen!

We didn't have avacado so I didn't put any in. I added more ice cubes than it called for. I nuked the carrots for two minutes in water in the microwave (takes out some of the nutrients:( but makes them blend smoother) and I also added some honey and sugar because this was SUPER sour but I really liked it! What I did: I put the lemon and water in first and blended then added the kale ice cubes carrots ginger and parsley and blended again. Then added the apples and hit it again. MY blender sucks so this was pretty "pulp-y" but definitely loved the taste. VERY refreshing!

I docked this one star only because I felt the tart lemon overpowered the other flavors too much. However it is great nutrition so I will probably make this smoothie again with half a lemon next time. Also in spite of distinctly remembering picking out some parsley at the store I somehow didn't end up with it at home so I threw in a little fresh mint instead. I am sure the parsley would be good also but I did like the mint enough to use it again. Something else I did was put in the avocado pit and leave the lemon peel on. I am sure we all know the great nutritional benefits of avocados and lemons but did you know the avocado pit and the lemon peel actually are the parts of those fruits with the most nutrition? I know it sounds crazy to put the pit in and I am not sure if I would have dared to try it in my Ninja Pro (maybe the new Ninja Ultima could do it) but my new Vitamix didn't miss a beat. My drink was smooth and creaamy. By the way my dog begged for some too and to my surprise liked it--although he did seem a little puzzled by the tartness.
Pretty good, I agree with another reviewer that the lemon juice comes through a little strong so maybe half a lemon next time. It's also not super flavorful otherwise, but it is healthy and filling
